titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 841: Historia Troiana

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (Zacour-Hirsch). Author from explicit (f. 140r).
Incipit (1st work): Etsi cotidie vetera recentibus obruantur...
Explicit (1st work): Ego Guido de Columpna messana pridem ... Factum est autem presens opus domini incarnatione. Mille CCLXXXVIII eiusdem, prime indictionis. Amen. Deo Gratias. Explicit.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Colonna's Historia Troiana, plus 2 unrelated decrees.

msItem.title: Note about the author, f. i recto
Decree legitimizing three illegitimate individuals, f. 141v
Decree creating a notary public and justice in ordinary, f. 142r

supportDesc.extent: 142 leaves : 276 x 213 (218 x 122) mm. bound to 285 x 216 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, iii (modern paper) + 142 + ii (modern paper); [1-142]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto. Catchwords on the verso of every twelfth leaf, except for 60v.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive script, with the main text written by a single hand, and the 2 decrees written by a second hand. Passages left blank in the main text were completed later by a 15th-century hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red used for initials (sometimes additionally decorated with fine red or black flourishes), paragraph marks, and capital strokes in the main text.

history.provenance: Formerly owned by William Harrison Woodward (bookplate, inside upper cover).

keywords.term: Romances, Latin (Medieval and modern)--Early works to 1800
